WQkv0ywD_5zfdjAR1eQI1A.text: Had a voucher and wanted to check out at least one Indian restaurant while in London. This one was just up the street from the hotel so it was perfectly convenient. The restaurant is bright and colourful and really inviting. The service was very friendly and helpful. My mom had a prawn curry and I had a vegetarian Thali. I rarely get platters because I usually don't want to try everything in it but this one just looked and smelled amazing. I tried a little bit of everything and it was all fantastic. For a chain, I have to say, this was way better than any of the places here in Vegas. The prices were extremely reasonable; especially considering how much food we were served. I will be back next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

_7H1KLCW70JPpWxrZxbjKg.text: This latest branch of Masala Zone doesn't officially open until the end of the week, but locals have been drawn in by the promise of very generous pre-launch offers. Just got back from a half price meal with a friend. We were lucky to have got a table as availability was very limited and people had to be turned away.The food is as excellent as at the other outlets I have sampled. This is serious competition to long-established Khan's just down the road.Not quite convinced by the Bollywood decor, but this may be mainly due to the fact that most of the panels were being ripped off the walls while we were eating. The interior designer must have had a bit of a tantrum when he saw the artwork put up in all the wrong places  I think they need to get the plasterers back in. Unusual dinner entertainment.Most of the staff were still in training but our waitress was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.I look forward to coming back when they are in full swing.

I_MSw9cSjRDe2dQJ64-RPQ.text: This is a local chain and it's yumtown. Here's the thing, you have a restaurant and you have really good food, right? It's so good that you have to open another location, then another, and another...all of a sudden you're a local chain. Maybe people start to think that the food is bad, because of the "chain" affiliation; but they're wrong! Not 'dead wrong' (it's not that serious), but they're missing out. I absolutely love the Lunch Thali's; they really hit the mark on being the perfect amount of food. Satisfying, but not heavy or greasy. Also, the Dali Puri. Holy Sh*t. This appetizer is all kinds of awesome and I'm always tempted to make it my whole meal. The way the flavors and textures go together is just perfect. I can only attest to this location, but the staff are WONDERFUL. So nice and genuine. The decor is vibrant and playful. They also have a lower seating area that seems like it would be good for kids...In conclusion:Staff 5+Food 5+Introducing me to Dali Puri (infinity points)+Lunch Thali's 5+Decor 5Location 5Cocktails! 5

VCos2mofgzmRS5f3T7ww3w.text: Wonderful central London fusion curry.  Great service, great green and yellow curries.  Spicy pumpkin and potatoes were especially good.  Bar and drinks selection were not so good, but everything else is great.  Not too expensive either, especially for central London.

x6wNnuCwvRjBHyJodv9GKw.text: We ordered a delivery take out from this particular Masala Zone and wasn't at all pleased with the food. Being Indian, I rarely expect amazing things from Indian take aways or restaurants, but I do expect the food to be enjoyable to an extent and satisfactory. The salad was wilted and drenched in dressing. We had a couple of grand thalis, one meat and the other chicken. Although I'd asked for my order to be very very hot, i could barely taste the chillis and the overall taste of the food was near unpleasant. More and more I'm convinced that decent Indian restaurant food exists only in the north and midlands (Bradford, Manchester, Birmingham and Leicester).

5JdfNRUEhf4SC_BWe-dAxw.text: Yummy indian homestyle food! I have only done takeaway but I loved it and this is from someone who knows her indian food! It is inexpensive and really worth it!

AVTgA6NgL-pdo3DFDRKBMQ.text: I have eaten here about five times now. The food has always been hot and tasty, and the service attentive. I generally go for a grand thali, and have yet to be disappointed. A huge metal tray covered with smaller metal dishes of food, all well balanced in flavour, and they change each time you go there. You also get a good helping of rice in the middle of the tray, chappati, masala poppadom, chutneys, yoghurt, and of course the main curry that you choose from the menu. Definitely recommended. The colourful 'firework box' decor, and other Indian kitsch signs make a wonderful backdrop for some delicious food. I have been there with a group of people born and brought up in India, and they loved it too. It's only a matter of time before I go again!

5uaK1v1HhKxunsMj0EhyKg.text: Masala Zone is surprisingly good. We all had the Thali for lunch, and it was great, authentic (at least from what I remember about the real thing), tasty and reasonably priced.Wish I could say the same about Brick Lane....

5opawsdl2JJmSQm-tktumQ.text: After watching a movie thought a curry would be a perfect ending to the evening. How dissapointing. The starters came out after the mains! They dropped the rice from the mains on the table and floor and not replaced it! Service was quick however kept getting most things wrong to the point it was a joke. Food was average and not in a mood to go there again. 2 out of 5.

XGvMkc3UKnQEjDBkh9s_-g.text: I was really happy to see Masala Zone open on this site as I live in this area! It is as good as any of the other branches, food is tasty and reasonably priced, I thought the staff were very attentive and I liked the decor, its really colourful (which was nice when it was grey outside). I'm sure I'll become a regular!

vU0aMieyej8XRfy8XYMNzw.text: The food is awful everything is done on the cheap. Stick to khans if not even better the Standard.

2_MOUycEIB4_Yq7LQjZM6w.text: The food is ok and it is what I expected from a trendy style place.  Their hot, is not what I consider hot.  I guess they temper it for more mass appeal.  However, I  would eat here again and the prices are reasonable.  My only compliant was that our server thought she was "too cool for school" and was generally unpleasant to us.

yWPhSKNoNli8BxZNxHeDxQ.text: Really great, authentic thaali, with fresh ingredients and quick, courteous service. I took away the leftovers and they packed it up in an awesome take away container. Amazing!I will be returning often!!!

gQVmgA8-deL9BnqUaT--3g.text: According to the concierge at my hotel, 'it's pretty good hygienic'  - now if that isn't a overwhelming recommendation, I don't know what is. In all seriousness, this place really surprised me - you walk in and immediately recognize it as an upscale chain restaurant. This isn't a bad thing - you know they have processes in place that are make for a consistently good meal. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and seated in a comfortable table near the window. The waitress handed me a menu and also a pictorial menu of some of their most popular dishes. She patiently explained the Thali, which is a stainless steel platter with little bowls of various dishes - lentils, potatoes, or curry - that can be ordered in two sized. I had the Grand Thali and chose the lamb rogan josh as my curry. What a treat - the side dishes change regularly I'm told, so each night could be a different adventure that makes going back several times more fun. I would also pair the meal with the Meantime London Lager. It's a light beer with real flavor that compliments the spiciness of the meal perfectly.

ZJ6zKVhUMjIlPTRDiowj6g.text: had thali for the first time. the curry was good, and I personally really liked the lentil soup (?) that came with the curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. regular chicken thali

LbVxMl65W6_wrOjgQo8pig.text: I really liked this place. Good food, nice service, relaxing atmosphere for a quick eat.I had the Thali with the potato/banana curry, my husband the lamb vindaloo. The vindaloo was the best of the two dishes, but overall the quality was quite good. Also, it wasn't as greasy as Indian food tends to be, a definite plus in my book.Surprisingly, as I seldom expect much from restaurant chains. Being so close to my flat, I would certainly go back and try other dishes.

ahn0xTFYgKbqo_27tc_vVw.text: Although it's a chain....it's so authentic and delicious. They had a special going on that if you spend £10 on food, you get a £4.50 drink credit. I loved the Regular Thali which was huge. I left so happy and full. Will continue to go back!

husvKI_LEIetlJlEAuHv8g.text: Wow - great smells and even better tastes!  My family and I really loved this Masala in Bayswater.So here's the deal.  My wife, 16-yr old daughter and 6-yr old son arrived from San Francisco in the morning for a 4-week stay in London (working).  We got our flat set up and needed a place in the neighborhood.  Masala Zone showed up with solid reviews around the corner so we thought we'd try it, jet lagged an all.  It hit the spot.First - it's clean, bright and the wait staff was really friendly.  We had a Spanish waitress and several others helping us throughout the evening.  Very attentive so we never had to wait for anything.The food was terrific.  To start, we ordered garlic naan and some wheat biscuits you fill with a spicy sauce that were fantastic.  Then Chicken Tika that was perfectly cooked (tender, juicy, not dry) with great flavor.  We also had a vegetarian curry that was very flavorful, but a little oily for my taste.  Not unusual for a curry, but unlike all the other dishes they served which were flavorful without being oily.  They also had a cool kids menu with 6-7 choices for our little guy, which made him happy.Oh, I forgot.  They had a nice bar with a mango passion fruit dark rum cocktail that really hit the spot :).  For both me and my daughter (thanks to the UK's drinking lower age).My only suggestion for the restaurant is to provide different entree dishes.  While beautiful, they have a sloping lip at the ends that makes utensils slide and fall into your food unless you are really careful.  Just a nit, but a way for Masala to improve.We'll definitely be going back during our stay to enjoy the great food and service.

nB101npSykv-bqqAlfKTZA.text: REAL Indian experience? Doubtful. Nevertheless, still delicious.

BoQ8bBF2qN4frrUkIoThYA.text: It is an ok place for indian foodThe waitresses could be nicer like waiters.I haf once that the waitress first forgot to bring all of order and after that we realised that she also took our order wrong. However at the end they brought our first order and didnt charge for either of the foods.The decoration is noceThe quality of food is good in comprison to priceThe environment in general is very warm and welcomingIm not aware of any better indian cusin in bayswater. If I found any I would definitely will go otherwise this is the place I might visit again

IrmpmpGNNzO7iv7jXIVCZQ.text: Masala Zone,Modern restaurant that is trying to keep the traditions of Indian food while trying modernize and franchise the food just enough to maintain consistency.Perfect a quick guaranteed.The interior is alternative modern poster art on the walls which I thought was cool looking at while I was waiting for my butter chicken Masala.The food was good. However I've been spoiled in the past by other indian restaurants in DC and Dubai which makes me a fussy Indian food eater and hard to please. I thought the food needed a little bit more spice but like I said consistency and English taste buds could not process spicy.

8XJvPS37MEXv72YrcXUcRQ.text: Masala Zone, when I have not been in to see you after awhile you start to haunt my dreams.  I love your grand thalis.  Yes, you're a chain and that's kind of icky, but your food is just so good and consistent and your restaurant so clean and reliable.This location is far less busy than the Covent Garden location which is very nice although you loose a point for having so many families with children there.  I am starting to think you need a "family section" because when we request to not be seated near children, we always have to wait as they seem to be everywhere.  Nothing kills your appetite faster than a child toddling up to your table like they belong there.  Maybe ask their parents to keep them at their own tables?  Otherwise, your curries are just sooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Chutneys

T2lLMRIGO31rXfo28F_u-Q.text: I live quite close to this restaurant but never thought to go there until a friend recommended it. I've now been there several times and will continue to eat here, as it is lovely!First thing to mention are the supremely chilled out staff. Every request I've ever had, they've accommodated. Every member of staff I've encountered has been lovely and relaxed. Service is very quick, too.Second thing to mention is the selection. If you're a vegetarian, this is heaven! I hesitated to go for a long time because they don't post menus on t heir site, but have faith! There are great vegetarian choices, but it's perfectly suitable for a meat-eater as well!Third thing is that the food is -lovely-. It's delicate but robust, varied but consistent, and just orgasmically delicious. I always get the grand thali (almost like a pick n mix curry type of thing) but to be honest it's more than I can humanly eat. I've had some of the little appetizers and enjoyed them a lot too. The prices are fair, I'd even say quite good. When husband and I go, we each have dinner and a drink or two and it's usually around £30.  All in all, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone! Ignore the naff wall art and go for the food and for a nice, calm meal!

GWMSqw-u8q5x2-MhlM5Now.text: This was some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Beautiful, clean restaurant, attentive service, and killer food. Can't ask for much more than that.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

Z2NkTOhYpOPLMrkMcJYDew.text: I went here with a group on tour and they tour leader had arranged with them that we would come. The food was served quickly, however, service was awful. We were obviously eating spicy food and we would drink water. The waitresses came once or twice to fill up our drinks after we had to get their attention. It got to the point where one of our group members had to get up and grab water and serve our fellow group members. The food we had was okay, I'm not a big Indian food eater, but it was the service that made me dislike the place.

Ec9ghA0pYng-UPwarWzGOg.text: Their marketing is better than their food.  The chaat offerings are good but my lamb curry is bested by any "traditional curry house."

kn5YKHz0TSeUqpDq68wQFA.text: Great joint - we usually take deliveries form here.  Not too greasy, classical Indian all at a great price - highly recommend it!

5VGaBBcTD4fG2xzv-y5Mww.text: Fabulous variety! Refreshingly, a little different than standard Indian menus I've gotten comfortable with. Their Thali combo dishes are quite good. I had the green chicken curry, and my wife had the butter chicken curry. Both were excellent. They also had wifi!

ZH3unVzQQeIrcN54syu3Zw.text: Came at 5:30, Ordered a mango lassi, little pricey but good. Got the grand thali-buttered chicken. It was good, white meat which I prefer. Too much for me to finish but If I had a fridge at my hotel I would've taken the rest home. They include the tip on the bill which was fine with me because I was going to tip higher than the % they charge. I'd come again. Almost 18 pounds total. Had to ask for the bill, my only tiny complaint.

mv-ibmlidgkQ8cOYDyIYCg.text: This was a very pleasant find! I looked at a number of Indian restaurants in the Bayswater area and this was generally best reviewed. The reviews were all correct. I had the Lamb Rogan Josh Thali and it was fabulous. I added a Bhel as an appetizer and it was perhaps the best I've ever had. I was very tempted to add another order of the rogan josh, but the serving size was exactly right.

kcrNlGJ4Y2mE-5iSH-7HKQ.text: You probably look into this place and cast judgement, as I did, at the tables all arranged neatly in a big open space and scoff at the naff decor. You conclude that in its unashamed chain-outlet resplendence, in the centre of the gastronomic wasteland near Queensway, that it is the nightmare offspring of a bad curry house and a Pizza Hut and should therefore be avoided like the plague. As I did. To do so is to miss out on a real treat. The food is different, a fresh twist on Indian and really very good indeed. We had a mouthwatering starter of chickpeas in tamarind - an explosion of flavour, sometimes savoury, sometimes spicy, with dashes of some crazy lime pickleness running through it. Onto the main, two different vegetable thalis. Mine had banana and lotus root as a main with three delicious mini-bowls of loveliness. Potatoes with cashew sauce...okra...apparently the sides change daily. I got ambitious with my second drink and ordered the "Masala Coke" - a best-avoided SAVOURY spicy coke which despite my usual sense of adventure just didn't work. I didn't say anything, but the waiter was blessed with telepathy and asked if I liked it and would change it if not...how unusual is that?I'd love to dock a star for the decor but the meal and experience was that good I just can't.  Give it a go. The food alone is something else and streets ahead of 99% of all the Indian restaurants I've dined at. Yum.

PmkGm1uI7g2hKJufAGSIvw.text: Perfect combination of moderate price, clean, excellent healthy food, nice staff. Went two nights in a row. Thalis were excellent. I found the raita a little bland but that seems standard in London.

fDeBvJSgFvFhj_Ukj7zwfw.text: My dinner here was really good! I started with the Dahi Puri which was yummy but not the BEST I've had. Then I had the Butter Chicken with rice, plain nan, and a side of the dal of the day. All of that was really good. I enjoyed the decor of the place and the staff was really friendly!

a-5Ij66TUXew2V9Wrxq3Aw.text: Decent for the price. But the selection was disappointingly small. Many of my favorite Indian food items were not on their menu. Ambience was 5 but food was a 3.

BPloKGnytqUGPyN7XkAXIw.text: Simply outstanding !!! Wow , the variety of flavors and quantity. A definitive visit if you are in London

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

jX9l1ArOrAdEH3JwESvLQQ.text: The interiors were beautiful, ethnic and glittery. The service was good. They checked for last round of orders and dessert towards the end. The biryani tasted slightly sour/tangy and the ingredients were slightly different from what I was expecting. Lots of pomegranate on top. The fried brinjal on top was not impressive either. It tasted just okay. Daal was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Ethnic decor
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Biryaani

hD-j4O-iAZ-lOWzniN_qMQ.text: Really good Indian restaurant - enjoyed eating there! The service was good without being exceptional, the food was tasty, the portions very appropriate and the price good (given that we're talking about London...). Will come back and would definitely recommend!

YVGPgr9o2wRKjrzLhsc4IQ.text: While we were in London I wanted to try some Indian food because there are only one or two good places to go to back home. Masala Zone turned out to be an excellent choice. I admit I found myself looking at a menu where I didn't really know what was going on, but the staff was friendly and helpful and we had an excellent meal. If you don't like spicy, that is okay, neither does my wife and they have excellent options for this. If you do like spicy and all the flavor that comes with Indian curries this is hallowed ground. Good sized seating area at this place, we did not have to wait.

KW61cnqdkM1_1wPQU_IOmA.text: I've been in London for ten days for my first time and been constantly getting sick. This place has been a haven for me on this trip. Food is fresh, aesthetically pleasing, and soooooooooo good. Great place. Customer service is top notch as well. Prescil was my server both times. She is so smiley and welcoming. This place is quality. The most artistic and fast Indian place I've ever been to. What I ordered: Vegetable Samosa Veggie thali Chai and mango lassi

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

2-oQDRGpz6fyHJG_btWp-w.text: A solid 4* for Masala Zone. The place itself is decorated nicely, light and open, plenty of space between tables and has a small open kitchen. The menu isn't huge but has the awesome Thali along with a choice of 8ish curries, some sharing starters and biryanis.My friend and I both went for a Thali, which for £14 max includes a 4oz curry, 2 vegetable sides, a lentil side, 2 chapatis or rice, a popadom and chutneys. I love Thalis! It means you get to try lots of different dishes but without ordering crazy amounts of food. The lamb rogan josh was good (spicy, full of flavour), the potato curry was ok but my favourite was the broccoli curry which was delicious! The lentil curry was a bit watery and bland and the chapatis a little cold but everything else was piping hot and all the food was good except the chapatis. What made it a lovely meal out apaaaart from the feast of delicious food was the service. The waitress was so friendly, happy and attentive (continually filling up my water - I'm not so good with spice!). You are able to reserve tables which in this day and age in central London is a miracle and they also do takeaway - pick up or delivery through some of the apps. This is also a bit cheaper than the eat in menu along with no tip! I've been looking for a good Indian takeaway in my area for so long and now I've found it - gone are the days of watery or oily Friday night 'curries'!

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

XFqiHaUvTSHGeIopBSTeww.text: The food and service was excellent.  The prices are very reasonable and servings generous and venue very clean.  I would highly recommend this resturant.  Just remember food is a little on the spicy side.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom

MDG20vQ1jW6td3IzILzIJA.text: 3.5 stars for the good flavor of the food. 2.5 stars for the masala tea. For appetizers- We ordered the vegetable samosa (it's individual sized) and its comes with a small scoop of chickpeas and we also ordered the fried prawns(sauce comes cold and the prawns were fried with the batter similar to those of the fried fish). Entree: We ordered a vegetable dish (Undhiyo & Lentil Khichdi) and a lamb dish (Dhaaba Roghan Josh)Overall, portion size to price is a little above average price but worth a visit for the food. Helpful tip - if you want spicier or stronger Marsala tea, ensure to ask the waitress at the beginning of your order.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Undhiyo & Lentil Khichdi, Dhaaba Roghan Josh, vegetable samosa, Goan crispy fried prawns with vindaloo mayo ending with Marsala chai tea

XcGV5FD98qA4GVKjxqGIGg.text: FOOD IS AMAZING!!! We got the butter chicken thali and it was such a good spread with so much food. Everything was seasoned exceptionally and was so tasty. The service was great as well, very attentive, especially compared to other restaurants in London (since wait staff isn't working for tips). I've been to another masala zone and this one was a little nicer, set more for a nice dinner vibe and it was exactly what I wanted. If anyone is looking for Indian food, go here. Our hotel concierge also told us that he got reviews of the place from visitors from India and they said the food is extremely authentic and just like home.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Butter chicken thali

4IEC33QLJIF0DcUL0f_tLA.text: I love this place.. For an Indian.. This is very authentic ... All the oily curry that you get so many so called Indian restaurants is not always Indian food and is not the food common across India.. Have been frequenting this place for the last 4 years and have never had one average or bad experience.. The service and the food is amazing.. Will any day recommend this to anyone who wants good Indian food without all the noise and sham bam ...

UbfaNS0bRFYAOLqWIn3tJA.text: Visiting my friend in Bayswater and she took me there. The place was recommented by her Indian flatmate. Easy to spot location and welcoming interior. Modern， spacious and brightly lit by the sunnday day. Super clean and efficient service. We ordered a chicken Thaili，a lamb Thaili and some African Chow Chana burger. Nice potion for ladies and lovely combination of sauces and dip :)))Reasonably priced for the area. Would definitely recommend that :)

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Its a dumpling. Delicious but a bit pricy for its delicate portion.

1CqvTVGe1U1zDRHqUn-NLw.text: We had a lovely meal here which was very decently priced. Curry puffs were tiny but packed with flavour.We had a chicken madras which was tasty and spicy but not overpowering. The naan (both plain and garlic) were soft and perfectly cooked. The vegetable korma was very plain and flavorless which is the only dish bringing this down to four star rather than five. Tiny restaurant area upstairs but looks like more seating downstairs - seemed to be a function or similar on while we were there.

uww4OFBEzMIaKYcXY4L1jQ.text: The only place I can find a grand thali (sp?) since I left the Valley. Nice interior. Vibrant, classic saturated colors.  Big space. Good Windows. The interiors in London are often claustrophobic. Not here.  Very nice staff. Everything we had was properly seasoned. Safe bet. They have a few restaurants in high rent areas. No brainer if you like this kind of food. On the high side $ though, so 4 stars.

Q3zfLp-iTKshHnhQFnIguA.text: Execeptional.  The young guy who waited on us made some great recommendations - seafood biryani, veg samosas, etc.  He was also really friendly and polite.  The food was simply outstanding.  Modern decor, but not so posh as to be off-putting.  When we went, there were families, couples, some singles.  Really nice place.

_mPJxqyCW9hCDXeXl01RqA.text: Great place to have Indian food. The Butter Chicken is a bit spicy for those who like it. Avoid the lemon drink thing. It's not as good as it seems.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Masala Zone

m2FRIhqUppxDYMrEL7l1NA.text: We loved it all! Ordered the Grand Thali and three different appetizers it was amazing! Prices aren't bad at all and the flavor of the dishes were on point. Would love to have another meal before we leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Masala Zone - Bayswater - London, United Kingdom. Just delicious! More papadums please!!

P6CINBr0JzvCBXuzkOFmCA.text: Overpriced and kind of very unauthentic in my opinion. I've been there several times because it's right next to my house and I'm disappointed each time. Why do I keep going back?!??? :(((

lFyqf8_gtKogd0SA2AwIMQ.text: I ordered the grand thaili with lamb josh curry and my gf ordered the butter chicken curry. Both curries were good but the butter curry was better.Anycase, we both had a splendid time.
